unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Probability: Taking at Least Four Free Throws
question_text:
Suppose a free-throw shooter with a $75\%$ success rate attempts free throws until one is missed.
What is the probability that the shooter is able to make four successful free throws in a row?
solution:
The probability of making four free throws is equal to the complement of a having a miss within the first four shots.

First, we must find the individual probabilities:

$$P(1) = 0.25$$

$$P(2) = 0.75 \cdot 0.25$$

$$P(3) = 0.75 \cdot 0.75 \cdot 0.25$$

$$P(4) = 0.75 \cdot 0.75 \cdot 0.75 \cdot 0.25$$

Then we take the sum of these probabilities, which represents the probability of a missed shot within three or fewer shots:

$$(0.25)+(0.75 \cdot 0.25)+(0.75 \cdot 0.75\cdot 0.25)+ (0.75 \cdot 0.75 \cdot 0.75 \cdot 0.25) = 0.683594$$

...and subtract from $1$ to find the complement of that probability:

$$1-0.683594 = 0.316406$$

Choice 'C' is correct.
